name: Maso di Villa Relais di Campagna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As the previous reviewer said, this place is a bit remote. Don't let that put you off -- it is definitely worth the effort! In fact, the driving directions on the website are perfect and it is an easy 1-hour drive to the big parking lot just outside Venice. From the door of the B&B to St. Mark's square was about 1-1/2 hours.
reviews.title: Great B&B with a great trattoria as a bonus

likes.liked: — the beauty of the surrounding countryside

reviews.text: The B&B is a converted old farmhouse in the middle of the vineyards. It is so idyllic it looked like something out of a cartoon -- too perfect to be true. The pictures on the web site are quite accurate. What you see is really what you get.
reviews.title: A great countryside experience

aka: Maso Di Villa Relais Di Campagna Italy/Collalto Di Susegana
description: MASO DI VILLA Relais di Campagna is a romantic country inn, full of charm and hospitality. Every day our passion leads us to re-invent out relais, to create a true “home away from home”. At less than an hour from Venice with a view towards the foothills of the Alps, this great stone farmhouse stands all by itself on a hilltop in five hectares of woodland surrounded by vegetable gardens and vines.The property have been completely restored, rigorously respecting the original architecture dating back to the year 1800, using only period brick and stone. The SIX DOUBLE ROOMS "WITH A VIEW" have been individually and elegantly decorated in an original and warm style, to create a delicately pretty effect, and particular attention has been given to every detail, using only fabrics and materials of the highest quality to create a much sought after atmosphere. EACH ROOM HAS ITS OWN ATMOSPHERE: a particular colour, a custom-made wrought iron bed or a wooden floral motif headboard, refined bed-linen and a wonderful view make each living space worthy of a visit. Breakfasts are served under the pergola during the warmer months and in the country “serra d’inverno”, with home-made jams and fruit from our big orchard, fresh squeezed fruit juice, fresh baked biscuits and pastries, coffee and tea, honey and cereals, eggs, ham and cheese, and other locally prepared products characteristic of the area.
